intro: Comanthosphace nepalensis, commonly known as the Himalayan liverwort, is a small, leafy liverwort belonging to the family Comastomataceae. It is characterized by its closely packed, green, and succulent leaves that form a dense mat. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in the mountainous regions of Nepal and adjacent areas. It plays a vital role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
